title: We deserve an explanation for why @Tantram thought it was appropriate to tie honor to ranked
body:
We still don't have report cards Tantram explicitly promised us.
We still don't have ANY of the other increased transparency Tantram explicitly promised us.
We still don't have ANY of the other behavior-related features Riot has hinted at over the last two years.
We still don't have warnings re-added to the game.

I don't understand why Riot would think for a second that this is appropriate in the current state of the honor system when they should be adding those things first, and then tying honor into existing systems. Does your team not care about shipping a finished product before you force it onto mature systems that have been in place for 8 years? Are you just not accountable for the quality of your product the way other teams at Riot are? I want to understand why this takes priority over actually finishing your product.

Honor 2.0 feels more like Honor 0.2. You have TWO YEARS to finish up Honor 2.0 before tying it into other systems and you have made literally no progress. Not a single new feature (even ones that were explicitly confirmed) has been added since Honor 2.0 launched.

replies.body: Cz I highly doubt you need an upgraded Honor system to just **not be toxic**.

A. Nobody needs and honor system to not be toxic.
B. Honor systems are not about "not being toxic."

Honor isn't really tied to Ranked.  Your honor doesn't affect your rank or your access to the game mode.  What they did is tie *rewards* to honor, which is debatable, but logical.  You can still play Ranked and climb the ladder.  You can still receive a high rank.  You just aren't getting the bonus *aesthetic rewards* (exception: Challenger backpack is tangible) if you drop below the baseline behavior expectations, but you can climb all the way to top Challenger with Honor locked at 0.

Hmm.? Tantram never promised us anything in regards to what he's working on. 

The latest hint that Tantram has hinted was https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/jZzbL8JG-semi-annual-reminder-we-havent-gotten-monthly-status-cards-yet, which was 7 months ago, not 2 years ago.

Honors 2.0 got iceboxed long time ago.

Care to share a source for those explicit promises? Not saying they don't exist, but I'm here pretty often and can't say I remember any.
And it wouldn't be the first time people confuse "we are currently working on X" with a promise.

Click on player behavior. Change hot to best. Top thread of all time is Tantram promising us transparency that never delivered. We need to hold him accountable and potentially make him the new Lyte. You know, the old head of player behavior that would promise us features they never planned on actually delivering, and would make the system more strict with every chance they got.

Top thread of all time is on extreme one in a million edge cases that are manually handled. The only promise I could find in that very long post was actually delivered in the form of their new policy regarding those edge cases.

Second top thread is indeed about reform cards where he states that his team has "played around" with some "cool ideas" while even going as far as explicitly denying any sneak peak and clarifying that the point of the post is to show his agreement with the idea **as a player**.

So still waiting for an actual source of an "explicit promise". As a matter of fact I'm waiting for even **more** sources now that you brought up even more alleged promises.

Just to reiterate: 
Stating to be working on a feature is not a promise to deliver that feature. Projects get held up, put on ice or even scrapped entirely. It's a normal and very frequent thing to happen during development.
If the system is nowhere near finished, maybe Rito should not tie it to ones that are 8 years mature ...

How is that relevant to anything I said?
How is that relevant to anything **you** said?

"Projects get held up, put on ice or even scrapped entirely"

If work on Honor 2.0 is at roadblocks, maybe Riot should use it for ranked rewards after that is resolved and not before. I'm not opposed to them using it, even Honor 2 and not Honor 1, but in its state of development that should not be.

The idea that Honor 2.0 is incomplete because those features are missing is only your opinion, though. If Riot **had** made promises you might have a solid argument for it being incomplete until those promises were delivered, but so far you have no been able to provide any evidence for this.

can i have links to these promises? I must have missed them

From [/dev: More on 2019 Ranked Rewards](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2018/10/dev-more-on-2019-ranked-rewards/):

> **WHY DOES MY HONOR LEVEL AFFECT RANKED REWARDS?**
>
> It might seem counterintuitive to some players that we withhold rewards and reward progress below a certain Honor threshold, but—to us—sportsmanship is a big deal in competitive play, both in and outside of League.
> 
> When we look at the most successful Ranked players, they’re the ones who can stay cool under pressure, lead their teams in difficult circumstances, and work together to win games. Ranked rewards are all about bragging rights and recognizing success, so we can use Honor to make sure you’re being a good teammate before we hand them out. 

The short, sweet, & simple version is - Ranked is a competitive thing, and competition has the requirement of sportsmanship.

Tantram is a coder and engineer. He works on implementing the system.

He does not, to my knowledge, set most of the policy. And he certainly doesn't set the policy for ranked.
